info.title: Airports API
info.description:
## Introduction
The Airports API, part of the [FlightStats APIs](/apis/flightstats-apis/overview), delivers important details about an airport including IATA/ICAO codes, location (lat/long), airport name, street address, elevation, UTC time zone offset and more. This data can be delivered as an XML or JSON response in English or Simplified Chinese.

The Airports API also lets you determine which airports are near a specified location (lat/long) within a specified radius. This is very useful for location-based applications (smart phones, tablets, and in-dash navigation systems.

Airports API answer questions such as:
* What are all the active airports in the world?
* What are the details for the Airport with this code?

IATA codes are 3 letter codes maintained by the International Air Transport Association and guaranteed to be unique. IATA can reuse airport codes when an old airport closes. 

ICAO codes are 4 letter codes maintained by the International Civil Aviation Organization and guaranteed to be unique. The first character in the code corresponds to the country the airport resides in. Not every airport has an ICAO code.

FlightStats code is the 2-3 letter codes assigned to the airline in FlightStats systems and are unique.

Notes: IATA airport codes are also know as location identifier or station codes, and may include railway and bus stations in addition to just airports. 

When airports close or the code stops being used for whatever reason, FlightStats marks the airport record as inactive. Inactive airport information may still be valid in case like Historical Flight Status, so both active and inactive airports are returned. If you are only interested in active airports, then use the Active Airports API.

Reference data is typically downloaded and cached in customer systems. Cirium recommends our customers refresh their caches of reference data at least weekly.

## Extended options
Besides the normal [extended options](/apis/flightstats-apis/get-started), the Airport APIs support _excludeRailwayStations_. When set, the API removes all railway stations from the response.

## Licensing
The Airport APIs are standard APIs and included in our Commercial and Contract plans. 

A breakdown of the available plans is available on [Get evaluation account](/apis/flightstats-apis/get-evaluation-account#)

## Schemas
Click the download button at the top of this document to download the OpenApi spec for this API. Other schemas:

Long term support 
* SOAP (deprecated) - [WSDL](https://api.flightstats.com/flex/airports/docs/v1/lts/soap/airportsService.wsdl) [XSD](https://api.flightstats.com/flex/airports/docs/v1/lts/soap/airportsService.xsd)
* REST - [WADL](https://api.flightstats.com/flex/airports/docs/v1/lts/rest/airportsService.wadl) [XSD](https://api.flightstats.com/flex/airports/docs/v1/lts/soap/airportsService.xsd)

Extended fields
* SOAP (deprecated) - [WSDL+XSD](https://api.flightstats.com/flex/airports/soap/v1/airportsService?wsdl)
* REST - [WADL](https://api.flightstats.com/flex/airports/rest/v1/schema/wadl) [XSD](https://api.flightstats.com/flex/airports/rest/v1/schema/xsd) [JSON](https://api.flightstats.com/flex/airports/rest/v1/schema/json)

## Similar APIs
[Aeronautical (Laminar Data Hub)](/apis/laminar-data-hub/aeronautical-v2) - Aerodrome (airport) reference data for Laminar Data Hub

[Airlines](/apis/flightstats-apis/airlines) - Reference data for Airlines

[Equipment](/apis/flightstats-apis/equipment) - Reference data for Equipement

get.description: Returns a listing of currently active airports

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: The data format returned in the response

parameters.name: extendedOptions
parameters.description: [Extended options](/apis/flightstats-apis/get-started) for modifying standard API behavior to fit special use cases

200.description: A list of all active airports.

Multiple Airports (languageCode:zh).description: Airports response with multiple airports, with extendedOptions=languageCode:zh
Airports response with multiple airports, with extendedOptions=languageCode:zh

400.description: Client request error. Consult error response for specifics.

403.description: Authorization failure. Invalid 'appId', 'appKey', or rate limit violation.

404.description: Requested item could not be found, or the endpoint does not exist.

5XX.description: API application error. If error is consistent, please contact Cirium Support.

Airport.description: The airport object contains the unique codes and name that identify a unique airport

fs.description: The Cirium code for the airport, globally unique across time

iata.description: The IATA code for the airport

icao.description: The ICAO code for the airport

faa.description: The FAA code for the airport

street1.description: The street address of the airport, part 1

street2.description: The street address of the airport, part 2

city.description: The city in which the airport resides

cityCode.description: The code of the city in which the airport resides

stateCode.description: The State in which the airport resides

postalCode.description: The postal code in which the airport resides

countryCode.description: The code for the country in which the airport resides

district.description: The district of the city in which the airport resides. Returned if specifying includeNewFields in extendedOptions.

countryName.description: The name of the country in which the Airport resides

regionName.description: The name of the region in which the Airport resides

timeZoneRegionName.description: The name of the Time Zone region in which the Airport resides

weatherZone.description: The NOAA weather zone (US only) in which the Airport resides

localTime.description: The local time at the Airport in ISO-8601 format. yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSS.

utcOffsetHours.description: The current UTC offset at the Airport

latitude.description: The latitude of the airport in decimal degrees

longitude.description: The longitude of the airport in decimal degrees

elevationFeet.description: The elevation above sea level of the airport in feet

classification.description: The Cirium classification of the size of the airport, 1(max) to 5(min)

active.description: Boolean value indicating if the airport is currently operational

weatherUrl.description: URL for the Weather service with current weather data for the Airport

delayIndexUrl.description: URL for the DelayIndex service with current delay information computed for the Airport

AirportsResponse.description:
The response body includes the following:
- InterpretedRequest - The API returns the information you requested, plus any interpretation of your request (for example, it will show you the FlightStats code for an airport that it is using and that may be different than the IATA or ICAO code provided)
- APIResponseError - If there is an error, the response includes this error object describing the problem
- airport - If the result is a single airport, the API returns the airport in this element
- airports - If the result includes more than one airport, the API returns an array of Airport elements

ApiResponseError.description: In the default case, when an error occurs the API returns a 200 status code and this structure contains information about the error. Not returned if specifying _extendedOptions=useHTTPErrors_, in which case the API returns the HTTP error code and _text/plain_ body containing the same information as in the structure.

httpStatusCode.description: This is the standard HTTP code (400, 401, 404, etc...)

errorId.description: This is a unique identifier for the error used internally at Cirium. Include this string in helpdesk requests to help us troubleshoot issues.

errorMessage.description: This contains detail about the error. If there are multiple errors in the request, the string may have multiple items separated by a '|' character.
errorMessage.example: Invalid value for carrier: AAAA|Invalid value for date: 1969-02-02 - The date specified is not within the expected range. Earliest allowed date '2021-08-23'

appIdQueryParam.description: ID of the application making the request
appIdQueryParam.name: appId

appKeyQueryParam.description: Authentication key of the application making the request
appKeyQueryParam.name: appKey

appIdHeader.description: ID of the application making the request
appIdHeader.name: appId

appKeyHeader.description: Authentication key of the application making the request
appKeyHeader.name: appKey
